content.description:
Eripiunt subito nubes caelumque diemque
Teucrorum ex oculis; pontopontus, -i, m. = mare, -is nox incubatincubo, -are: to lie upon atra.
Intonuereintono, -are, -ui: to thunder1 polipolus, -i, m. = caelum, -i, et crebriscreber, -bra, -brum, adj.: frequent micatmico, -are: to flash ignibus aether,
praesentempraesens, -ntis, adj.: instantque viris intentantintento, -are: to threaten omnia mortem.

Line 5Extemploextemplo, adv. = statim Aeneae solvuntur frigorefrigus, -oris, m.: cold membra.
Ingemitingemo, -ere: to groan, et duplicesduplex, -icis, adj.: both tendens ad sidera palmas
talia voce refert: “O terter, adv.: three timesque quaterque beati,
quisquis = quibus ante ora patrum Troiae sub moenibus altis
contigit oppetereoppeto, -ere = cado, -ere!”

Aeneid 1.88-961:intonuere = intonuerunt↩
content.question:
Answer the following question(s) in English unless the question specifically asks you to provide Latin words.
Indicate the scansion of line 7. 
talia voce refert: O terque quaterque beati
You may use any of the methods listed in the reference information.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
